com.ojcoleman.bain.synapse.spiking

Class Clopath2010SynapseCollection

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.amd.aparapi.Kernel
      • com.ojcoleman.bain.base.ComponentCollection
        • com.ojcoleman.bain.base.ConfigurableComponentCollection<C>
          • com.ojcoleman.bain.base.SynapseCollection<Clopath2010SynapseConfiguration>
            • com.ojcoleman.bain.synapse.spiking.Clopath2010SynapseCollection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ComponentConfigurationListener, java.lang.Cloneable

    public class Clopath2010SynapseCollection
extends SynapseCollection<Clopath2010SynapseConfiguration>
    Implementation of the model described by Clopath et al.: "Connectivity reflects coding: a model of voltage-based STDP with homeostasis", (2010).
    Author:
    Oliver J. Coleman
    See Also:
    Clopath2010SynapseConfiguration

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init()
        Description copied from class: ComponentCollection
        Initialise the collection. This method should be called from a sub-classes constructor. Sub-classes should override this method to generate pre-calculated values used during the simulation, and call this super-method. Arrays/buffers initialised here and used in the run() method/kernel should be transferred to the execution hardware using put().
        Overrides:
        init in class SynapseCollection<Clopath2010SynapseConfiguration>

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Description copied from class: SynapseCollection
        Resets all synapses to their initial state (see SynapseCollection.initialEfficacy). Sub-classes should override this method if state variables other than the efficacy and synapseOutputs must be reset, or if they should be set to something other than 0. The overriding method should invoke this super-method (before doing anything else). Arrays/buffers reset here and used in the run() method/kernel should be transferred to the execution hardware using put().
        Overrides:
        reset in class SynapseCollection<Clopath2010SynapseConfiguration>

      • run

        public void run()
        Description copied from class: SynapseCollection
        Implements the basic infrastructure for processing a synapse by updating the values of ComponentCollection.outputs and SynapseCollection.neuronInputs. Sub-classes may override this method, and if they modify the SynapseCollection.efficacy they must call the super-method after modifying it.
        Overrides:
        run in class SynapseCollection<Clopath2010SynapseConfiguration>

      • isNotUsed

        public boolean isNotUsed(int synapseIndex)
        Description copied from class: SynapseCollection
        Return true iff this synapse has no effect on the network. This default implementation returns true iff the initial efficacy of the synapse is 0. Subclasses should override this method if some additional criteria should be used to determine this (for example a learning rate parameter for a synaptic plasticity function).
        Overrides:
        isNotUsed in class SynapseCollection<Clopath2010SynapseConfiguration>
        See Also:
        SynapseCollection.compress()

      • getStateVariableNames

        public java.lang.String[] getStateVariableNames()
        Description copied from class: SynapseCollection
        Get an array containing the names of all the internal state variables. Sub-classes may override this to allow the component to be used for testing or educational purposes. This default implementation returns the SynapseCollection.efficacy field.
        Overrides:
        getStateVariableNames in class SynapseCollection<Clopath2010SynapseConfiguration>

      • getStateVariableValues

        public double[] getStateVariableValues(int synapseIndex)
        Description copied from class: SynapseCollection
        Get an array containing the values of all the internal state variables, in the same order as that given by getStateVariableNames(). Sub-classes may override this to allow the component to be used for testing or educational purposes. The overriding method should ensure the state variables are up to date by invoking ComponentCollection.ensureStateVariablesAreFresh(). This default implementation returns the SynapseCollection.efficacy field.
        Overrides:
        getStateVariableValues in class SynapseCollection<Clopath2010SynapseConfiguration>

      • getConfigSingleton

        public ComponentConfiguration getConfigSingleton()
        Description copied from class: ConfigurableComponentCollection
        Get a reference to the sub-class specific ComponentConfiguration object for this ConfigurableComponentCollection.
        Specified by:
        getConfigSingleton in class ConfigurableComponentCollection<Clopath2010SynapseConfiguration>

      • ensureStateVariablesAreFresh

        public void ensureStateVariablesAreFresh()
        Description copied from class: ComponentCollection
        Ensure the state variable values have been fetched from the remote execution hardware (eg GPU) if necessary. See ComponentCollection.stateVariablesStale. Implementations of this method should set ComponentCollection.stateVariablesStale to false. (If sub-classes override an implementation of this method they should typically call the super method after they have fetched any data from the remote execution hardware as the overridden implementation of this method should set ComponentCollection.stateVariablesStale false).
        Overrides:
        ensureStateVariablesAreFresh in class SynapseCollection<Clopath2010SynapseConfiguration>

      • createCollection

        public ComponentCollection createCollection(int size)
        Description copied from class: ComponentCollection
        Create a new collection of this type of the given size. Implementations of this method should call ComponentCollection.init().
        Specified by:
        createCollection in class ComponentCollection
        Parameters:
        size - The size of the new collection.
